required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Efficacy of Two Different Doses of Asacol in the Treatment of Moderately Active Ulcerative Colitis
clinical_study.official_title: A Double-Blind, Randomized, 6-Week, Parallel-Group Design Clinical Trial to Assess Safety and Efficacy of Asacol 4.8 g/Day (800 mg Tablet) Versus Asacol 2.4 g/Day (400 mg Tablet) for the Treatment of Moderately Active Ulcerative Colitis

brief_summary.textblock: This study is a prospective clinical study to evaluate the safety and efficacy of two different doses of Asacol for the treatment of moderately active ulcerative colitis. In addition, a new tablet formulation will be evaluated at one of the two doses.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Treatment Success Patients at Week 6, ITT (Intent to Treat) Population
primary_outcome.description: Treatment success defined as complete response (PGA score 0 and complete resolution of stool frequency, rectal bleeding, PFA (patient's functional assessment), normal sigmoidoscopy) or partial response (improvement from baseline PGA and improvement in 1 clinical assessment [stool frequency, rectal bleeding, PFA, sigmoidoscopy] and no worsening in any other clinical assessments)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Ulcerative Colitis Disease Activity Index (UCDAI) at Week 6, ITT Population
secondary_outcome.description: UCDAI - sum of clinical assessment scores (stool frequency score [0=normal, 1=1-2 stools > normal/day, 2=3-4 stools > normal/day, 3=5 or more stools > normal/day], rectal bleeding score [0=no blood seen, 1=streaks of blood with stool less than half of the time, 2=obvious blood with stool most of the time, 3=blood alone passed and PGA score [0=quiescent disease, 1=mild, 2=moderate, 3=severe]) and sigmoidoscopy score [0=normal, 1=mild, 2=moderate, 3=severe]

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Whose Rectal Bleeding & Sigmoidoscopy Score Both Improved From Baseline to Week 6, ITT Population
secondary_outcome.description: Rectal Bleeding - 0=no blood seen, 1=streaks of blood w/stool less than half of the time, 2=obvious blood w/stool most of the time, 3=blood alone passed Sigmoidoscopy Assessment Score - 0=normal (intact vascular pattern, no friability or granularity), 1=mild (erythema, diminished or absent vascular markings; mild granularity; friability), 2=moderate (marked erythema, granularity; absent vascular markings; bleeds with minimal trauma; no ulcerations) 3=severe (spontaneous bleeding, ulcerations)

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Patients Whose Sigmoidoscopy Score Improved From Baseline to Week 6, ITT Population
secondary_outcome.description: Sigmoidoscopy Assessment Score (0=normal intact vascular pattern, no friability or granularity, 1=mild erythema; diminished or absent vascular markings; mild granularity; friability, 2=moderate marked erythema, granularity; absent vascular markings; bleeds with minimal trauma; no ulcerations, 3=severe spontaneous bleeding, ulcerations)

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Patients With an Improvement in Stool Frequency, ITT Population, Week 6
secondary_outcome.description: 0=Normal stool frequency per day, 1=1-2 stools greater than normal per day, 2=3-4 stools greater than normal per day, 3=5 or more stools greater than normal per day

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Patients With Improvement in Rectal Bleeding, ITT Population, Week 6
secondary_outcome.description: Rectal Bleeding (0=no blood seen, 1=streaks of blood with stool less than half of the time, 2=obvious blood with stool most of the time, 3=blood alone passed)

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Patients With Improvement in Patient's Functional Assessment (PFA), ITT Population, Week 6
Percentage of Patients With Improvement in Physician Global Assessment (PGA)Score, ITT Population, Week 6
secondary_outcome.description: PGA -Physician's Global Assessment - 0=quiescent disease (all parameters 0), 1=mild disease (parameters mostly 1's) 2=moderate (parameters mostly 2's), 3=severe (parameters mostly 3's) [parameters: combination of stool frequency, rectal bleeding, PFA & sigmoidoscopy findings] If scoring equal default to physician judgement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Total Inflammatory Bowel Disease Questionnaire (IBDQ) at Week 3, All Randomized Patients
secondary_outcome.description: IBDQ-32 questions divided into 4 categories: bowel, systemic, emotional and social. Each question graded with the following responses: 1-more than ever before, 2-extremely frequently, 3-very frequently, 4-moderate increase in frequency, 5-some increase in frequency, 6-slight increase in frequency or 7-not at all/normal; 1/worst thru 7/best. Scoring 32 - 224 - higher score better.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Total Inflammatory Bowel Disease Questionnaire (IBDQ) at Week 6, All Randomized Patients
secondary_outcome.description: IBDQ-32 questions divided into 4 categories: bowel, systemic, emotional and social. Each question graded with the following responses: 1-more than ever before, 2-extremely frequently, 3-very frequently, 4-moderate increase in frequency, 5-some increase in frequency, 6-slight increase in frequency or 7-not at all/normal; 1/worst thru 7/best. Scoring 32-224 - higher score better.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Patients With Moderate, Left-Sided Disease at Baseline Classified as Treatment Success at Week 6, All Randomized Patients
secondary_outcome.description: Treatment success defined as complete response (PGA score 0 and complete resolution of stool frequency, rectal bleeding, PFA (patient's functional assessment), normal sigmoidoscopy) or partial response (improvement from baseline PGA and improvement in 1 clinical assessment [stool frequency, rectal bleeding, PFA, sigmoidoscopy] and no worsening in any other clinical assessments)

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Treatment Success Patients at Week 3, ITT Population
secondary_outcome.description: Treatment success defined as complete response (PGA score 0 and complete resolution of stool frequency, rectal bleeding, PFA (patient's functional assessment), normal sigmoidoscopy) or partial response (improvement from baseline PGA and improvement in 1 clinical assessment [stool frequency, rectal bleeding, PFA, sigmoidoscopy] and no worsening in any other clinical assessments)

intervention.description: tablets, 4.8 g/day for 6 weeks, 2 - 800 mg Asacol tablets and 2 placebo tablets 3 times daily
tablets, 2.4 g/day for 6 weeks, 2 - 400 mg Asacol tablets and 2 placebo tablets 3 times daily

facility.name: University of Puerto Rico, School of Medicine

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Recruitment began Feb. 28, 2001. Randomized 386 patients of which 117 had mild disease and 268 had moderate disease at baseline. Analysis only includes patients with moderate disease at baseline.

group.title: Asacol 2.4 g/Day
group.description: Two 400 mg Asacol tablets and 2 placebo tablets (matching 800 mg formulation) taken 3 times daily (morning, midday, evening).

group.title: Asacol 4.8 g/Day
group.description: Two 800 mg Asacol tablets and 2 placebo tablets (matching 400 mg formulation) taken 3 times daily (morning, midday, evening).

outcome.description: Treatment success defined as complete response (PGA score 0 and complete resolution of stool frequency, rectal bleeding, PFA (patient's functional assessment), normal sigmoidoscopy) or partial response (improvement from baseline PGA and improvement in 1 clinical assessment [stool frequency, rectal bleeding, PFA, sigmoidoscopy] and no worsening in any other clinical assessments)

group.title: Asacol 2.4 g/Day

measure.title: Percentage of Treatment Success Patients at Week 6, ITT (Intent to Treat) Population
measure.description: Treatment success defined as complete response (PGA score 0 and complete resolution of stool frequency, rectal bleeding, PFA (patient's functional assessment), normal sigmoidoscopy) or partial response (improvement from baseline PGA and improvement in 1 clinical assessment [stool frequency, rectal bleeding, PFA, sigmoidoscopy] and no worsening in any other clinical assessments)
measure.population: ITT Population with Moderate Disease [PGA = 2] at Baseline

analysis.groups_desc: It was assumed that true rate of improvement for 2.4 g/day treatment group is 40% and for the 4.8 g/day group is 60%. To detect a true difference of 20% between these 2 groups with 2-sided test, type I error of 0.05 (alpha = 0.05), and power of 80%, 120 patients with moderately active ulcerative colitis were required per group to complete the study.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Ulcerative Colitis Disease Activity Index (UCDAI) at Week 6, ITT Population
outcome.description: UCDAI - sum of clinical assessment scores (stool frequency score [0=normal, 1=1-2 stools > normal/day, 2=3-4 stools > normal/day, 3=5 or more stools > normal/day], rectal bleeding score [0=no blood seen, 1=streaks of blood with stool less than half of the time, 2=obvious blood with stool most of the time, 3=blood alone passed and PGA score [0=quiescent disease, 1=mild, 2=moderate, 3=severe]) and sigmoidoscopy score [0=normal, 1=mild, 2=moderate, 3=severe]
outcome.population: ITT Population with Moderate Disease [PGA = 2] at Baseline.

group.description: Two 800 mg Asacol tablets and 2 placebo tablets (matching 400 mg formulation) taken 3 times daily (morning, midday, evening).

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Ulcerative Colitis Disease Activity Index (UCDAI) at Week 6, ITT Population
measure.description: UCDAI - sum of clinical assessment scores (stool frequency score [0=normal, 1=1-2 stools > normal/day, 2=3-4 stools > normal/day, 3=5 or more stools > normal/day], rectal bleeding score [0=no blood seen, 1=streaks of blood with stool less than half of the time, 2=obvious blood with stool most of the time, 3=blood alone passed and PGA score [0=quiescent disease, 1=mild, 2=moderate, 3=severe]) and sigmoidoscopy score [0=normal, 1=mild, 2=moderate, 3=severe]
measure.population: ITT Population with Moderate Disease [PGA = 2] at Baseline.

analysis.method_desc: The 2-sample t-test will be used to examine the treatment effect.
Teh 2-sample t-test will be used to examine the treatment effect.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Whose Rectal Bleeding & Sigmoidoscopy Score Both Improved From Baseline to Week 6, ITT Population
outcome.description: Rectal Bleeding - 0=no blood seen, 1=streaks of blood w/stool less than half of the time, 2=obvious blood w/stool most of the time, 3=blood alone passed Sigmoidoscopy Assessment Score - 0=normal (intact vascular pattern, no friability or granularity), 1=mild (erythema, diminished or absent vascular markings; mild granularity; friability), 2=moderate (marked erythema, granularity; absent vascular markings; bleeds with minimal trauma; no ulcerations) 3=severe (spontaneous bleeding, ulcerations)
outcome.population: ITT Patients with Moderate Disease [PGA=2] at Baseline. Percentage of patients whose rectal bleeding AND sigmoidoscopy scores BOTH improved from baseline at Week 6

outcome.title: Mean Change From Baseline in Total Inflammatory Bowel Disease Questionnaire (IBDQ) at Week 3, All Randomized Patients
outcome.description: IBDQ-32 questions divided into 4 categories: bowel, systemic, emotional and social. Each question graded with the following responses: 1-more than ever before, 2-extremely frequently, 3-very frequently, 4-moderate increase in frequency, 5-some increase in frequency, 6-slight increase in frequency or 7-not at all/normal; 1/worst thru 7/best. Scoring 32 - 224 - higher score better.
outcome.population: All Randomized Patients with Moderate Disease[PGA=2] at Baseline. Questionnaire analyzable if patient answered 28 of 32 for total, 8/10 for bowel, 3/5 for systemic, 10/12 for emotional, 3/5 for social.

outcome.description: Treatment success defined as complete response (PGA score 0 and complete resolution of stool frequency, rectal bleeding, PFA (patient's functional assessment), normal sigmoidoscopy) or partial response (improvement from baseline PGA and improvement in 1 clinical assessment [stool frequency, rectal bleeding, PFA, sigmoidoscopy] and no worsening in any other clinical assessments)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 60 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
